article.headline: Appalachian St. 95, Georgia Southern 82
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. -- Donald Sims scored a career-high 29 points and Isaac Butts had career-highs of 17 points and 19 rebounds as Appalachian State defeated Georgia Southern 95-82 on Monday night. The Mountaineers (9-11, 6-6 Southern Conference) led 44-33 at halftime, then shot 68 percent from the field (17 of 25) in the second half. The Eagles (7-13, 5-7) rallied to cut the margin to 56-53 with 13:13 left. Ben Drayton III, who had a career-high 22 points, hit a pair of 3-pointers and two other baskets during the Georgia Southern surge. Appalachian State then used an 8-2 run to pull away and finished the game hitting 22 of 28 free throws. The Mountaineers also had a 45-34 rebounding edge. Kellen Brand added 18 points for Appalachian State, while Jeremi Booth had 14 and Josh Hunter tallied 10. Julian Allen chipped in 16 points for the Eagles.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
